sub_topic: Identifying the automorphism group of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the graph G shown below: 

```
          1
         / \
        2---3
         \ /
          4
```

Determine the automorphism group of this graph, i.e. the set of all bijective functions from the vertex set of the graph to itself that preserve the edges of the graph.
message_2:
To find the automorphism group of the given graph G, we need to find all the bijective functions that preserve the edges of the graph. The graph G has 4 vertices, so there are 4! = 24 possible permutations of the vertices. We will check each permutation to see if it preserves the edges of the graph.

1. Identity function (no change): f(1)=1, f(2)=2, f(3)=3, f(4)=4
2. Swap 2 and 3: f(1)=1, f(2)=3, f(3)=2, f(4)=4
3. Swap 1 and 4: f(1)=4, f(2)=2, f(3)=3, f(4)=1
4. Swap 1 and 4, then swap 2 and 3: f(1)=4, f(2)=3, f(3)=2, f(4)=1

These are the only 4 permutations that preserve the edges of the graph. Therefore, the automorphism group of this graph is:

{f1, f2, f3, f4} where
f1(x) = x (identity function)
f2(1) = 1, f2(2) = 3, f2(3) = 2, f2(4) = 4
f3(1) = 4, f3(2) = 2, f3(3) = 3, f3(4) = 1
f4(1) = 4, f4(2) = 3, f4(3) = 2, f4(4) = 1
